alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Inland Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin County through 615 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Palm City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stuart, Indiantown, Palm City, J And S Fish Camp and North River Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
